Comments
Security/officers are frequently around and searching the parking lots as well as a number you call if you need anything as well.
There are many choices and always activities going on around campus.
Most students, especially those working or looking to save some money. non-traditional students fit right in with the freshman straight out of high school.
Considering the education and price you definitely get more than you pay for.
There are intramural sports and many clubs to join.
The cafeteria hours are strange and not very convenient, but the food is decent.
there are no dorms but they do offer discounted apartments, especially to single mothers.
My classes were challenging without overwhelming me and prepared me for the real world.

Go talk to someone at the school, they will tell you everything you need to know about if AC is the place for you. It is certainly cheaper, and has a very flexible schedule for those of us that work in addition to going to school full time.

Amarillo College offers many options for help from which classes to take and navigating their campus or websites. The instructors are very easy to approach and willing to help. Improved parking would be a great addition.

Develope good study habits and become active in the clubs A.C has. In three sentences The best school for my educational needs. understanding proffessors who lecture with complete accuacy.
